title: Wholesale pharmaceutical website with public catalog, Google-based customer login for ordering, and separate admin panel

requirements.text: Implement customer authentication that allows users to sign in with a Google account and require authentication only when placing an order (public browsing must not require login).

quotes: no please use login with google

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated visitors can view the full product catalog and product detail information without being redirected to login.
Attempting to add to cart and/or submit an order triggers a sign-in flow.
After successful sign-in, the user is returned to the intended action (e.g., cart/checkout) without losing selected items.
The app stores a stable customer identifier to associate orders with the signed-in customer.

requirements.text: Create a dedicated, separate admin login flow using admin email + password and restrict all admin functionality to authenticated admins only.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin routes/pages are not accessible unless the user is authenticated as an admin.
Admin authentication is distinct from customer authentication and does not grant customer accounts admin capabilities.
An admin can log out and is then prevented from accessing admin pages until logging in again.

requirements.text: Build the public product catalog UI with alphabetical (A–Z) sorting and an A–Z letter filter, showing product name, image, dosage form, packing details, wholesale rate/price, and bonus scheme for each product.

quotes: Each product shows: Product name, Product image, Dosage form, Packing details, Wholesale rate/price, Bonus scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Product list is sorted A–Z by product name by default.
Selecting a letter filter shows only products whose names begin with that letter; there is also an option to clear the filter.
Each product card/list row visibly includes all requested fields (name, image, dosage form, packing, price, bonus scheme).
UI is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement product management in the admin panel: add, edit, delete products; upload/update product photos; set product rate/price; add/update bonus offers; and manage product categories.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can create a new product with all required fields and it appears in the public catalog.
Admin can update an existing product (including image) and changes reflect in the public catalog after refresh.
Admin can delete a product and it no longer appears in the public catalog.
Categories can be created/edited and products can be assigned to categories (even if categories are not prominently displayed in the public UI yet).

requirements.text: Implement a cart and wholesale order/inquiry workflow: authenticated customers can add products to cart, review an order summary, submit an order/inquiry, and view their order history.
acceptanceCriteria: Customer can add/remove products in a cart and adjust quantities.
Order summary clearly lists items, quantities, and the associated wholesale price/bonus information.
Submitting an order persists the order server-side and shows a confirmation state to the customer.
Customer order history page lists previously submitted orders and their basic details (date, items count, status/label).

requirements.text: Provide an admin-facing order management view that lists incoming orders/inquiries and their details, serving as the primary "notification" mechanism within the app.

quotes: Order notification sent to admin email

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can view a list of submitted orders sorted with newest first.
Admin can open an order to view customer identifier, submitted items, quantities, and submitted timestamp.
Newly submitted orders appear in the admin order list without requiring manual data entry.

requirements.text: Create site pages and layout: header with company name “Hi-Tech Pharmaceuticals Pvt. Ltd.” and navigation (Home | About Us | Products | Contact Us); About Us section content (overview, mission & vision, commitment); Contact page showing email and phone, plus a contact form; footer with © and disclaimer text.

quotes: Company name “Hi-Tech Pharmaceuticals Pvt. Ltd.” prominently at the top
Navigation menu: Home | About Us | Products | Contact Us

acceptanceCriteria: Header displays the exact company name and the requested nav items, and navigation works on mobile and desktop.
About page contains sections for overview, mission & vision, and commitment to quality/compliance/ethical trade (English text).
Contact page displays: hitechpharmaceutical.pvt.ltd@gmail.com and +977 9761626880, and includes a working inquiry form UI with submit confirmation.
Footer includes “© Hi-Tech Pharmaceuticals Pvt. Ltd.” and the exact disclaimer: “For wholesale trade purposes only”.

requirements.text: Apply the requested clean, modern hi-tech medical design with a white/blue/light gray color scheme, professional/trustworthy styling, and full responsiveness across the customer site and admin panel.

quotes: White, blue, and light gray color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Consistent typography, spacing, and component styling across pages using the specified color scheme.
All primary flows (browse products, filter A–Z, login, cart, order submit, admin CRUD) are usable on mobile widths without horizontal scrolling.
Admin panel is visually distinct as an admin area while still matching the overall design system.

requirements.text: Backend data model and access control: persist products (including image references), categories, customers, and orders; enforce role-based access so public reads are allowed for products while product/order administration is admin-only and customer order history is customer-only.

quotes: Database to manage: Products, Images, Prices & bonuses, Customers, Orders

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods for public product listing and filtering inputs needed by the UI.
Backend exposes update methods for admin product/category management that reject non-admin callers.
Backend exposes customer order creation and order-history retrieval that restricts history to the caller’s customer identity.
All persisted entities remain available across canister upgrades per standard stable storage practices (migration only if/when needed).

constraints: Google OAuth "Login with Google" as a standalone third-party auth integration is not supported on this platform; authentication must use Internet Identity. If Google-based login is required, it must be achieved via Internet Identity’s supported sign-in options (which may include using a Google account depending on the user’s device/browser support).
Outbound email delivery ("send notification to admin email") via SMTP/SendGrid/Mailgun is not supported; implement in-app admin notifications/order inbox instead.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if an upgrade requires state migration.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose those components instead.
nonGoals: Third-party auth providers other than Internet Identity
